Name: GRADIENT
Explanation: THE SLOPE OF THE TERRAIN EXPRESSED AS A RATIO OF DROP OR RISE IN THE TERRAIN TO THE HORIZONTAL CHANGE IN POSITION: I.E. THE NUMBER OF UNITS YOU MUST FORWARD TO ACHIEVE ONE UNIT OF DROP OR RISE. (E.G. AN ENTRY OF "5" WOULD MEAN THAT IN FIVE METRES OF FORWARD MOTION THE DROP/RISE IS ONE METRE). ZERO REPRESENTS LEVEL TERRAIN.

Name: GRADIENT OF APPROACH
Explanation: ANGLE OF APPROACH ENTERED AS A GRADIENT.

Name: GRADIENT OF EXIT
Explanation: EXIT ANGLE EXPRESSED AS A GRADIENT.
